result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jmontae L Bogan

records.addlTxt: All records scanned

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Case removed from electronic filing process

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State files amended information in 15CF487. Upon pl to amended charge, parties stipulate to 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES. 15CF950 is DRI. 15CF1871, upon pl to Ct 3, the State recommends a w/held sentence - 3 yrs prob.
P-NC to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guitly as above. PSI ordered
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Matter on the calendar today because the defendant had a change of heart based upon the implications of the agreement. The State indicates they still intend to amend the information. When the defendant changed his mind, the State was allowed to withdraw the information. The State proposes to amend information to attempted armed robbery.  

Defense makes speedy trial request

BTC: Amended information may be filed by the State and the process of filing the amended info/entering the plea to the amended charges will be completed on MH date.  Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
In 15CF487, the State amends the charge to attempted Robbery, PTAC and recommends 4 yrs WPS equal bifurcation - this is a stipulated agreement. 15CF950 is DRI. In 15CF1871, the defendant will plead to Ct 3. Cts 1 & 2 are DRI. The State recommends 3 yrs probation. The State stands silent on expungement.
P-
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same

Defense now indicates that he neglected to discuss some information with his client and asks for time do to so. Time was given by the Court

back on the record: defense now indicates defendant no longer wishes to change his plea but wishes to take the matter(s) to trial. The State withdraws amended information.

BTC: STC to be set  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for Robert Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Mr. Repischak will be ready to go on this, however, there is a Miranda/Goodchild motion and motion to amend information that hasn't been heard yet.

BTC: The Court will conduct Miranda/Goodchild prior to voir dire. The Court takes no action regarding motion to amend information at this time. JT remains

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Mr. Reed has received discovery and asks for FPT/JT. All offers are withdrawn as of today  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State has provided discovery but there is a few things still missing. Defense asks for short status  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Surety, re: Bond. Copies forwarded to all parties.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is recently appointed. Defense asks for a few weeks to review discovery. The State will make another complete copy of discovery for defense  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Atty Gregory Reed
granting motion to withdraw

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for FPT/JT. Defense asks that bond be modified to allow defendant to attend school. The State asks what school deft wishes to attend and if deft CAN attend that school. Deft will be attending Racine Alternative School

BTC: The Court declines to review the bond. The Court wants something in writing that deft will be allowed to return to school and where he may attend  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Def: requesting bond review
ST: objects
BTC: motion to modify bond denied  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Atty Michael Barth

Cts 1-3: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. No contact with the victim BC (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendant. TG & ST.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/house arrest through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to house arrest are medical appointments, attorney visits and court hearings. May not communicate via social media including Twitter. No visitors allowed in the home. Defendant is to be fully compliant with rules of mother's home.
Preliminary hearing on July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jmontae L Bogan in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
 Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
The State asks the Court to impose $2000.00 cash bond. Defense indicates that ZCI sent a letter indicating there was some issues with the unit. Defense asks for signature bond or co-signature bond with mother, who is present.

BTC: Bond to be set at $1000.00 cash. All terms and conditions of 15CF487 will be adopted in this bond  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
